intro: Phyllanthus attenuatus subsp. tucuruiensis, commonly known as the Tucurui phyllanthus, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in tropical rainforests.
